findings.title: Inconsistent, unclear or insufficient explanation
findings.description: Insufficient explanation may lead to large errors in internal contract accounting.

findings.title: Perpetual Wrong state requirements
findings.description: The code checks for !SETTLING which resolves to NORMAL and SETTLED, but the requirement is NORMAL for withdraw.

findings.title: Inconsistent totalSize Function Usage
findings.description: The totalSize function is used with different parameters, which may lead to inconsistent results. It is recommended to use a consistent parameter type for the totalSize function.

findings.title: AMM internal specification inconsistencies
findings.description: Inconsistencies found in AMM's internal specifications.

findings.title: Missing sources for mathematical calculations
findings.description: LibMath.sol does not contain any hints or references to the original source from where the code was taken from.

findings.title: Inconsistent Variable and Method Naming
findings.description: Most of the variable and method names do not reflect actual names in code, making it difficult to understand the context and increasing the risk of variables being used in the wrong numerical context.

findings.title: createPool does not mention that it can only be called once otherwise initFunding bails
findings.description: The createPool function can be initialized with amount == 0, and a subsequent call to initFunding can only happen once. This leads to a zero-size pool being created, which does not allow any liquidity to be added.

findings.title: createPool does not mention the state requirement NORMAL
findings.description: The createPool function documentation lacks a clear specification of the required state NORMAL.

findings.title: buyFromPool does not specify a minimum amount
findings.description: The buyFromPool function lacks specification of a minimum amount.
